title: Ticket #4108: document how all the different logs work
description: Our variety of logs can be confusing. Write a new section within the Administrator's manual chapter to categorize and identify how the various logging methods work.
remarks:
2014-Nov-25 15:59:44 by smoler:
  • job event log - a chronological listing of events for a single job.
    • Created because the submit description file has log = <file name>.
    • The events are documented in section 2.6.7.

  • daemon (or subsystem) logs - each daemon records events as it executes
    • file name of each log is inconsistent; when not explicit in param_info.in, set by configuration variable <SUBSYS>_LOG. Many of the daemon logs use a camel case for the daemon name, which is concatenated with Log.
    • size/rotation/locking are specified by a variety of configuration variables
    • events have a time stamp; contains detail of start up for a daemon, statistics (when enabled)

  • job queue log - a transaction log that is the schedd's database of all current jobs in the queue
    • default file is $(SPOOL)/job_queue.log
    • event numbering in src/condor_utils/ClassAdLogEntry.h
    • At intervals set by QUEUE_CLEAN_INTERVAL, condor_schedd goes thru the job_queue.log file and "truncate all transactions" to clean the file. Default is once per day. Thus, there is no maximum size for this file, so it needs to be in a partition with plenty of space.
    • If SCHEDD_BACKUP_SPOOL is True, make a backup copy of the job queue on schedd start up. Default is False.
    • MAX_JOB_QUEUE_LOG_ROTATIONS is maximum number of history files that are saved before deleting the one with the oldest timestamp.

  • event log - logs all job events for all jobs and all users
    • file name is set by configuration variable EVENT_LOG
    • size/rotation?

  • accountant log - a transaction log that is the negotiator's database of all accounting information, which are priorities
    • written by negotiator
    • ?? file name is not configurable? $(SPOOL)/Accountantnew.log
    • users are represented in the DB by username@uid_domain
    • MAX_ACCOUNTANT_DATABASE_SIZE sets max size in bytes of the file before it is "cleaned" or "compacted," rewriting the file in a more compact form.
    • admins interact with the DB by using condor_userprio

  • schedd audit log - optional log to record user-initiated events that modify the job queue
    • file name is set by configuration variable SCHEDD_AUDIT_LOG
    • size/rotation set by MAX_SCHEDD_AUDIT_LOG and MAX_NUM_SCHEDD_AUDIT_LOG
    • events are timestamped and the message identifies what changed for which job. Should be for any _rm _hold _release _submit command.

  • value of NEGOTIATOR_MATCH_LOG - a second log from the negotiator, written only with items that have DEBUG level D_MATCH
    • file name is set with configuration variable NEGOTIATOR_MATCH_LOG, and the default value is $(LOG)/MatchLog
    • size/rotation?

  • history log - optional log for info about all jobs that have completed
    • defaults to $(SPOOL)/history
    • written by schedd
    • size/rotation set by ENABLE_HISTORY_ROTATION, MAX_HISTORY_LOG, MAX_HISTORY_ROTATIONS
    • admins can view historical info with condor_history

For DAGMan, there are more logs:

  • the default node log -- used to enforce the dependencies of the DAG
    • default file name is set by configuration variable DAGMAN_DEFAULT_NODE_LOG
    • size/rotation?
    • one per DAG submission; each SUBDAG has its own log

  • dagman.out file - like a daemon log (for dprintfs)
    • file name is ??
    • size/rotation?
    • one per DAG submission; each SUBDAG has its own log

  • jobstate.log file - ?? (for Pegasus)
    • file name is ??
    • size/rotation?
    • one per DAG submission; each SUBDAG has its own log

  • node status file - not really log, as it forms a snapshot of the current status of a DAG
    • file name is ??
    • one per DAG submission
